```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
```
### Data Pasta

```{r}
df$date <- as.Date(df$date)
df$MAC <- forecast::ma(df$new_cases,14)
df$MAD <- forecast::ma(df$new_deaths,14)
```
```{r}
df %>% filter(date >="2020-12-01") %>% ggplot() + geom_line(aes(x=date,y=new_cases,col="Cases")) +
  geom_line(aes(x=date,y=MAC,col=" 14 Days")) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma)
```


```{r}
df %>% filter(date >="2020-12-01") %>% ggplot() + geom_line(aes(x=date,y=new_deaths,col="Deaths")) +
  geom_line(aes(x=date,y=MAD,col="14 Days")) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = comma)
```

```{r}
CA$date <- as.Date(CA$date)
colnames(US) <- c("date","cases","deaths")
US$date <- as.Date(US$date)
```

### Plot Raw Numbers

```{r}
ggplot() + geom_line(data=US,aes(x=date,y=deaths, col="US w/Ca"))
geom_line(data = CA,aes(x=date,y=deaths,col="W/o CA"))
```

### Calc 14 Day Rolling Mean


```{r}
US$MAC <- forecast::ma(US$cases,14)
US$MAD <- forecast::ma(US$deaths,14)

CA$MAC <- forecast::ma(CA$cases,14)
CA$MAD <- forecast::ma(CA$deaths,14)

```
